statement:
Let $A$ be a finite set of integers such that the $2$-fold sumset $2A$
is “small”, i.e., $|2A|<c|A|$ for some constant $c$. There exists an
$n$- of length $c'|A|$ that contains $A$, and such that $c'$ and $n$ are
functions of $c$ only.

[1]{}

Melvyn B. Nathanson. , volume 165 of [*GTM*]{}. Springer, 1996. .
